addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable S
r
Francis Walsingham knight, Principall secretary to her Ma
tie
.

24 Novemb
r
1589
From M
r
Bodley
rec
o
mendenth
Mons
r
Lect
. and sheweth whoe is intended by
e
states
touchinge his negociation.

page.lettertext:
It may please yo
r
H. The bearer herof Mons
r
Lect is deputed by
e citie of
Geneva,
to so-
licit her
Ma
tie
and other Princes, in
e behalf of
their afflicted state, wherof he himself and his
letters will geve ample informac
o
n. He was
forced to come first into these quarters, by con-
trarietie of winde and wether, and having letters
to
e General states of these Provinces, hath bin
instant w
t
them, and obtened a very favorable
answear. For they have promised to recommend
his cause effectually to the Provinces and townes,
and to be carefull in calling uppon them for a spee-
dy returne of their determinac
o
n. And if they can
not be induced to yeld to some relief, by way of
publicke cesment and contribution, they have put
him in hope
at some order will be taken for the
generall collecting of every privat mans benevo-
lence, wherein they give their worde to doe their
uttermost endevo
r
: whiche I thinke they will per-
fourme in good sort, for their owne reputation, and
to remove
e opinion conceaved of their want of
zele and good affection to
e cause of religion.
Uppon this th eir willing resoluc
o
n, for w
ch
he hath
staied heere but fower daies he hath left a suffi-
cient person behinde to negotiat in his absens, w
ch
is also done w
t
their advise, for
e winning of time.
Whiche I thought expedient to impart w
t
yo
r
H.
and
to
take therew
t
all my humble leave.
From
e Haghe. 24 N
o
89
Yo
r
H. most humbly bound Tho. Bodley
The frost is heere so ex-
treme at this present, that those
about
Gorch
u
,
Bommel
and
Dort
stand in very great feare of some
attempt by
e Enemie. For w
ch
cause
Count Maurice
is already departed
towardes those quarters, and there is
order taken for
e Englishe companies
whiche are heere in
Hollande,
to folowe
presently after.
